titleStmt.title: A midsommer nights dreame As it hath beene sundry times publickely acted, by the Right honourable, the Lord Chamberlaine his seruants. Written by William Shakespeare.
titleStmt.author: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By Richard Bradock] for Thomas Fisher, and are to be soulde at his shoppe, at the signe of the White Hart, in Fleetestreete,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A midsommer nightes dreame.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shoppe, at the signe of the White Hart, in Fleetestreete
